     25 const BLDeprecatedMessage = "This flag has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please switch to the '-ignorelist' option."
     26 
     27 var (
     28 	flagCodesearch   = flag.String("codesearch", "", "Path to the `codesearch` binary")
     29 	flagFetchReindex = flag.String("fetch-reindex", "", "Path to the `livegrep-fetch-reindex` binary")
     30 	flagApiBaseUrl   = flag.String("api-base-url", "https://api.github.com/", "Github API base url")
     31 	flagGithubKey    = flag.String("github-key", os.Getenv("GITHUB_KEY"), "Github API key")
     32 	flagRepoDir      = flag.String("dir", "repos", "Directory to store repos")
     33 	flagIgnorelist   = flag.String("ignorelist", "", "File containing a list of repositories to ignore when indexing")
     34 	flagDeprecatedBL = flag.String("blacklist", "", "[DEPRECATED] "+BLDeprecatedMessage)
     35 	flagIndexPath    = dynamicDefault{
     36 		display: "${dir}/livegrep.idx",
     37 		fn:      func() string { return path.Join(*flagRepoDir, "livegrep.idx") },
     38 	}
     39 	flagRevision     = flag.String("revision", "HEAD", "git revision to index")
     40 	flagUrlPattern   = flag.String("url-pattern", "https://github.com/{name}/blob/{version}/{path}#L{lno}", "when using the local frontend fileviewer, this string will be used to construt a link to the file source on github")
     41 	flagName         = flag.String("name", "livegrep index", "The name to be stored in the index file")
     42 	flagRevparse     = flag.Bool("revparse", true, "whether to `git rev-parse` the provided revision in generated links")
     43 	flagForks        = flag.Bool("forks", true, "whether to index repositories that are github forks, and not original repos")
     44 	flagArchived     = flag.Bool("archived", false, "whether to index repositories that are archived on github")
     45 	flagHTTP         = flag.Bool("http", false, "clone repositories over HTTPS instead of SSH")
     46 	flagHTTPUsername = flag.String("http-user", "git", "Override the username to use when cloning over https")
     47 	flagInstallation = flag.Bool("installation-token", false, "Treat the API key as a Github Application Installation Key when cloning")
     48 	flagDepth        = flag.Int("depth", 0, "clone repository with specify --depth=N depth.")
     49 	flagSkipMissing  = flag.Bool("skip-missing", false, "skip repositories where the specified revision is missing")
     50 	flagRepos        = stringList{}
     51 	flagOrgs         = stringList{}
     52 	flagUsers        = stringList{}
     53 )

     55 func init() {
     56 	flag.Var(&flagIndexPath, "out", "Path to write the index")
     57 	flag.Var(&flagRepos, "repo", "Specify a repo to index (may be passed multiple times)")
     58 	flag.Var(&flagOrgs, "org", "Specify a github organization to index (may be passed multiple times)")
     59 	flag.Var(&flagUsers, "user", "Specify a github user to index (may be passed multiple times)")
     60 }
     61 
     62 const Workers = 8
     63 
     64 func main() {
     65 	flag.Parse()
     66 	log.SetFlags(0)
     67 
     68 	if *flagDeprecatedBL != "" {
     69 		log.Fatalln(BLDeprecatedMessage)
     70 	}
     71 
     72 	if flagRepos.strings == nil &&
     73 		flagOrgs.strings == nil &&
     74 		flagUsers.strings == nil {
     75 		log.Fatal("You must specify at least one repo or organization to index")
     76 	}
     77 
     78 	if *flagInstallation {
     79 		if *flagGithubKey == "" {
     80 			log.Fatal("-installation-key requires passing a github key, via either -github-key or $GITHUB_KEY")
     81 		}
     82 		*flagHTTP = true
     83 		*flagHTTPUsername = "x-access-token"
     84 	}
     85 
     86 	var ignorelist map[string]struct{}
     87 	if *flagIgnorelist != "" {
     88 		var err error
     89 		ignorelist, err = loadIgnorelist(*flagIgnorelist)
     90 		if err != nil {
     91 			log.Fatalf("loading %s: %s", *flagIgnorelist, err)
     92 		}
     93 	}
     94 
     95 	var h *http.Client
     96 	if *flagGithubKey == "" {
     97 		h = http.DefaultClient
     98 	} else {
     99 		tok := &oauth2.Token{AccessToken: *flagGithubKey}
    100 		h = oauth2.NewClient(
    101 			context.Background(),
    102 			oauth2.StaticTokenSource(tok),
    103 		)
    104 	}
    105 
    106 	gh := github.NewClient(h)
    107 
    108 	if *flagApiBaseUrl != "" {
    109 		if !strings.HasSuffix(*flagApiBaseUrl, "/") {
    110 			log.Fatalf("API base URL must include trailing slash: %s", *flagApiBaseUrl)
    111 		}
    112 		baseURL, err := url.Parse(*flagApiBaseUrl)
    113 		if err != nil {
    114 			log.Fatalf("parsing base url %s: %v", *flagApiBaseUrl, err)
    115 		}
    116 		gh.BaseURL = baseURL
    117 	}
    118 
    119 	repos, err := loadRepos(gh,
    120 		flagRepos.strings,
    121 		flagOrgs.strings,
    122 		flagUsers.strings)
    123 	if err != nil {
    124 		log.Fatalln(err.Error())
    125 	}
    126 
    127 	repos = filterRepos(repos, ignorelist, !*flagForks, !*flagArchived)
    128 
    129 	sort.Sort(ReposByName(repos))
    130 
    131 	config, err := buildConfig(*flagName, *flagRepoDir, repos, *flagRevision)
    132 	if err != nil {
    133 		log.Fatalln(err.Error())
    134 	}
    135 	configPath := path.Join(*flagRepoDir, "livegrep.json")
    136 	if err := writeConfig(config, configPath); err != nil {
    137 		log.Fatalln(err.Error())
    138 	}
    139 
    140 	index := flagIndexPath.Get().(string)
    141 
    142 	args := []string{
    143 		"--out", index,
    144 		"--codesearch", *flagCodesearch,
    145 	}
    146 	if *flagRevparse {
    147 		args = append(args, "--revparse")
    148 	}
    149 	if *flagSkipMissing {
    150 		args = append(args, "--skip-missing")
    151 	}
    152 	args = append(args, configPath)
    153 
    154 	if *flagFetchReindex == "" {
    155 		fr := findBinary("livegrep-fetch-reindex")
    156 		flagFetchReindex = &fr
    157 	}
    158 
    159 	log.Printf("Running: %s %v\n", *flagFetchReindex, args)
    160 	cmd := exec.Command(*flagFetchReindex, args...)
    161 	cmd.Stdout = os.Stdout
    162 	cmd.Stderr = os.Stderr
    163 	if *flagGithubKey != "" {
    164 		cmd.Env = append(os.Environ(), fmt.Sprintf("GITHUB_KEY=%s", *flagGithubKey))
    165 	}
    166 	if err := cmd.Run(); err != nil {
    167 		log.Fatalln("livegrep-fetch-reindex: ", err)
    168 	}
    169 }
    170 
    171 func findBinary(name string) string {
    172 	paths := []string{
    173 		path.Join(path.Dir(os.Args[0]), name),
    174 		strings.Replace(os.Args[0], path.Base(os.Args[0]), name, -1),
    175 	}
    176 	for _, try := range paths {
    177 		if st, err := os.Stat(try); err == nil && (st.Mode()&os.ModeDir) == 0 {
    178 			return try
    179 		}
    180 	}
    181 	return name
    182 }

    184 type ReposByName []*github.Repository
    185 
    186 func (r ReposByName) Len() int           { return len(r) }
    187 func (r ReposByName) Swap(i, j int)      { r[i], r[j] = r[j], r[i] }
    188 func (r ReposByName) Less(i, j int) bool { return *r[i].FullName < *r[j].FullName }
    189 
    190 func loadIgnorelist(path string) (map[string]struct{}, error) {
    191 	data, err := ioutil.ReadFile(path)
    192 	if err != nil {
    193 		return nil, err
    194 	}
    195 
    196 	lines := strings.Split(string(data), "\n")
    197 	out := make(map[string]struct{}, len(lines))
    198 	for _, l := range lines {
    199 		out[l] = struct{}{}
    200 	}
    201 	return out, nil
    202 }
    203 
    204 type loadJob struct {
    205 	obj string
    206 	get func(*github.Client, string) ([]*github.Repository, error)
    207 }
    208 
    209 type maybeRepo struct {
    210 	repos []*github.Repository
    211 	err   error
    212 }
    213 
    214 func loadRepos(
    215 	client *github.Client,
    216 	repos []string,
    217 	orgs []string,
    218 	users []string) ([]*github.Repository, error) {
    219 
    220 	jobc := make(chan loadJob)
    221 	done := make(chan struct{})
    222 	repoc := make(chan maybeRepo)
    223 
    224 	var jobs []loadJob
    225 	for _, repo := range repos {
    226 		jobs = append(jobs, loadJob{repo, getOneRepo})
    227 	}
    228 	for _, org := range orgs {
    229 		jobs = append(jobs, loadJob{org, getOrgRepos})
    230 	}
    231 	for _, user := range users {
    232 		jobs = append(jobs, loadJob{user, getUserRepos})
    233 	}
    234 	go func() {
    235 		defer close(jobc)
    236 		for _, j := range jobs {
    237 			select {
    238 			case jobc <- j:
    239 			case <-done:
    240 				return
    241 			}
    242 		}
    243 	}()
    244 	var wg sync.WaitGroup
    245 	wg.Add(Workers)
    246 	for i := 0; i < Workers; i++ {
    247 		go func() {
    248 			runJobs(client, jobc, done, repoc)
    249 			wg.Done()
    250 		}()
    251 	}
    252 	go func() {
    253 		wg.Wait()
    254 		close(repoc)
    255 	}()
    256 	var out []*github.Repository
    257 	for repo := range repoc {
    258 		if repo.err != nil {
    259 			close(done)
    260 			return nil, repo.err
    261 		}
    262 		out = append(out, repo.repos...)
    263 	}
    264 
    265 	return out, nil
    266 }
    267 
    268 func runJobs(client *github.Client, jobc <-chan loadJob, done <-chan struct{}, out chan<- maybeRepo) {
    269 	for {
    270 		var job loadJob
    271 		var ok bool
    272 		select {
    273 		case job, ok = <-jobc:
    274 			if !ok {
    275 				return
    276 			}
    277 		case <-done:
    278 			return
    279 		}
    280 		var res maybeRepo
    281 		res.repos, res.err = job.get(client, job.obj)
    282 		select {
    283 		case out <- res:
    284 		case <-done:
    285 			return
    286 		}
    287 	}
    288 }
    289 
    290 func filterRepos(repos []*github.Repository,
    291 	ignorelist map[string]struct{},
    292 	excludeForks bool, excludeArchived bool) []*github.Repository {
    293 	var out []*github.Repository
    294 
    295 	for _, r := range repos {
    296 		if excludeForks && r.Fork != nil && *r.Fork {
    297 			log.Printf("Excluding fork %s...", *r.FullName)
    298 			continue
    299 		}
    300 		if excludeArchived && r.Archived != nil && *r.Archived {
    301 			log.Printf("Excluding archived %s...", *r.FullName)
    302 			continue
    303 		}
    304 		if ignorelist != nil {
    305 			if _, ok := ignorelist[*r.FullName]; ok {
    306 				continue
    307 			}
    308 		}
    309 		out = append(out, r)
    310 	}
    311 
    312 	return out
    313 }
    314 
    315 func getOneRepo(client *github.Client, repo string) ([]*github.Repository, error) {
    316 	bits := strings.SplitN(repo, "/", 2)
    317 	if len(bits) != 2 {
    318 		return nil, fmt.Errorf("Bad repository: %s", repo)
    319 	}
    320 
    321 	ghRepo, _, err := client.Repositories.Get(context.TODO(), bits[0], bits[1])
    322 	if err != nil {
    323 		return nil, err
    324 	}
    325 	return []*github.Repository{ghRepo}, nil
    326 }
    327 
    328 func getOrgRepos(client *github.Client, org string) ([]*github.Repository, error) {
    329 	var buf []*github.Repository
    330 	opt := &github.RepositoryListByOrgOptions{
    331 		ListOptions: github.ListOptions{PerPage: 50},
    332 	}
    333 	for {
    334 		repos, resp, err := client.Repositories.ListByOrg(context.TODO(), org, opt)
    335 		if err != nil {
    336 			return nil, err
    337 		}
    338 		buf = append(buf, repos...)
    339 		if resp.NextPage == 0 {
    340 			break
    341 		}
    342 		opt.ListOptions.Page = resp.NextPage
    343 	}
    344 	return buf, nil
    345 }
    346 
    347 func getUserRepos(client *github.Client, user string) ([]*github.Repository, error) {
    348 	var buf []*github.Repository
    349 	opt := &github.RepositoryListOptions{
    350 		ListOptions: github.ListOptions{PerPage: 50},
    351 	}
    352 	for {
    353 		repos, resp, err := client.Repositories.List(context.TODO(), user, opt)
    354 		if err != nil {
    355 			return nil, err
    356 		}
    357 		buf = append(buf, repos...)
    358 		if resp.NextPage == 0 {
    359 			break
    360 		}
    361 		opt.ListOptions.Page = resp.NextPage
    362 	}
    363 	return buf, nil
    364 }

    366 func writeConfig(config []byte, file string) error {
    367 	dir := path.Dir(file)
    368 	if err := os.MkdirAll(dir, 0755); err != nil {
    369 		return err
    370 	}
    371 	return ioutil.WriteFile(file, config, 0644)
    372 }
    373 
    374 func buildConfig(name string,
    375 	dir string,
    376 	repos []*github.Repository,
    377 	revision string) ([]byte, error) {
    378 	cfg := config.IndexSpec{
    379 		Name: name,
    380 	}
    381 
    382 	for _, r := range repos {
    383 		if *flagSkipMissing {
    384 			cmd := exec.Command("git",
    385 				"--git-dir",
    386 				path.Join(dir, *r.FullName),
    387 				"rev-parse",
    388 				"--verify",
    389 				revision,
    390 			)
    391 			if e := cmd.Run(); e != nil {
    392 				log.Printf("Skipping missing revision repo=%s rev=%s",
    393 					*r.FullName, revision,
    394 				)
    395 				continue
    396 			}
    397 		}
    398 		var remote string
    399 		if *flagHTTP {
    400 			remote = *r.CloneURL
    401 		} else {
    402 			remote = *r.SSHURL
    403 		}
    404 
    405 		var password_env string
    406 		if *flagGithubKey != "" {
    407 			password_env = "GITHUB_KEY"
    408 		}
    409 
    410 		cfg.Repositories = append(cfg.Repositories, &config.RepoSpec{
    411 			Path:      path.Join(dir, *r.FullName),
    412 			Name:      *r.FullName,
    413 			Revisions: []string{revision},
    414 			Metadata: &config.Metadata{
    415 				Github:     *r.HTMLURL,
    416 				Remote:     remote,
    417 				UrlPattern: *flagUrlPattern,
    418 			},
    419 			CloneOptions: &config.CloneOptions{
    420 				Depth:       int32(*flagDepth),
    421 				Username:    *flagHTTPUsername,
    422 				PasswordEnv: password_env,
    423 			},
    424 		})
    425 	}
    426 
    427 	return json.MarshalIndent(cfg, "", "  ")
    428 }
